intro: Anacampseros subalbida, commonly known as the white-flowered stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and low maintenance requirements make it an ideal plant for both novice and experienced gardeners.
